content.raw:
Package: libhdf5-serial-dev (1.10.0-patch1+docs-4) [universe]
    
    transitional dummy package

[https://packages.ubuntu.com/bionic/libhdf5-serial-dev](https://packages.ubuntu.com/bionic/libhdf5-serial-dev)

This is probably not the package you want. In general, avoid workarounds like this. With system Ubuntu/Debian/Red Hat packages this stuff should work right out of the box. If it doesn’t that’s either because of a problem on our side \(as I think it is here\) or a bug that needs to be reported upstream. Changing environment variables like this leads to a lot of inconsistency, and problems with less sophisticated users installing the software, and should be a last resort.

This is probably not the package you want. In general, avoid workarounds like this. With system Ubuntu/Debian/Red Hat packages this stuff should work right out of the box. If it doesn’t that’s either because of a problem on our side (as I think it is here) or a bug that needs to be reported upstream. Changing environment variables like this leads to a lot of inconsistency, and problems with less sophisticated users installing the software, and should be a last resort.
